[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84232: Title 6.Assessing risks to capital

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84233: 6.1 General considerations

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84234: 154. Competent authorities should assess and score the risks to capital that have been identified as material for the institution.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84235: 155. . The purpose of this title is to provide common methodologies to be considered for assessing individual risks and risk management and controls. It is not intended to be exhaustive and gives leeway to competent authorities to take into account other additional criteria that may be deemed relevant based on their experience and the specific features of the institution.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84236: 156. This title provides competent authorities with guidelines for the assessment and scoring of the following risks to capital:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84237: a. credit and counterparty risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84238: b. market risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [RISK:OPERATIONAL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84239: c. operational risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84240: d. interest rate risk from non-trading activities (IRRBB).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84241: 157. The title also identifies a set of subcategories within each risk category above, which need to be taken into account when risks to capital are assessed. Depending on the materiality of any these subcategories to a particular institution, they can be assessed and scored individually.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84242: 158. The decision on materiality depends on the supervisory judgement. However, for FX lending risk, in light of the ESRB Recommendation on lending in foreign currencies29, materiality should be determined taking into account the following threshold:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84243: Loans denominated in foreign currency to unhedged borrowers constitute at least 10% of an institution's total loan book (total loans to non-financial corporations and households), where such a total loan book constitutes at least 25% of the institution's total assets.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74] [RISK:REPUTATIONAL_RISK] [RISK:PENSION_RISK] [RISK:BUSINESS_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84244: 159. Competent authorities should also assess other risks that are identified as material to a specific institution but are not listed above (e.g. pension risk, reputational risk, strategic and business risk, step-in risk, intra- and inter-risk concentration). The following may assist with the identification process:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84245: a. drivers of TREA;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:74]
PARAGRAPH_84246: 29 ESRB Recommendation on lending in foreign currencies (ESRB/2011/1), OJ C 342, 22.11.2011, p. 1.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84248: b. risks identified in the institution's ICAAP;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84249: c. risks arising from the institution's business model (including those identified by other institutions operating a similar business model);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84250: d. information stemming from the monitoring of key indicators;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84251: e. findings and observations from internal or external audit reports; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84252: f. recommendations and guidelines issued by the EBA, as well as warnings and recommendations issued by macroprudential authorities or the ESRB.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84253: 160. The above elements should also be taken into account by competent authorities when they are planning the intensity of their supervisory activity in relation to the assessment of a specific risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75] [RISK:OPERATIONAL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84254: 161. For credit, market and operational risk, competent authorities should verify the institution's compliance with the minimum requirements specified in the relevant EU and national implementing legislation. However, these guidelines extend the scope of the assessment beyond those minimum requirements to allow competent authorities to form a comprehensive view on risks to capital.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84255: 162. When evaluating risks to capital, competent authorities should also consider the potential impact of funding cost risk following the methodology included in Title 8 and may decide on the necessity of measures to mitigate this risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84256: 163. In their implementation of the methodologies specified in this title, competent authorities should identify relevant quantitative indicators and other metrics, which could also be used to monitor key indicators, as specified in Title 3.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84257: 164. For each material risk, competent authorities should assess and reflect in the risk score:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84258: a. inherent risk (risk exposures); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84259: b. the quality and effectiveness of risk management and controls.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:75]
PARAGRAPH_84260: 165. This assessment flow is represented in Figure 4 below.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84262: Figure 4. Assessment workflow for risks to capital

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84263: Assessment of inherent individual risks

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84264: Assessment of individual risks and controls

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84265: Inherent risk assessment

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84266: Risk score

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84267: Assessment of risks management and controls

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84268: Risk management and controls assessment

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84269: 166. When performing their assessments, competent authorities should use all available information sources, including regulatory reporting, ad hoc reporting agreed with the institution, the institution's internal metrics and reports (e.g. internal audit report, risk management reports, information from the ICAAP), on-site inspection reports and external reports (e.g. the institution's communications to investors, rating agencies). While the assessment is intended to be institution-specific, comparison with peers should be considered to identify potential exposure to risks to capital. For such purposes, peers should be defined on a risk-by-risk basis and might differ from those identified for BMA or other analyses.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84270: 167. . In the assessment of risks to capital, competent authorities should also evaluate the accuracy and prudency of the calculation of minimum own fund requirements to identify situations where minimum own funds calculations may underestimate the actual level of risk. This assessment would inform the determination of additional own funds requirements as provided in Section 7.2.3.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84271: 168. The outcome of the assessment of each material risk should be reflected in a summary of findings that provides an explanation of the main risk drivers, and a risk score, as specified in the following sections.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84272: 6.2 Assessment of credit and counterparty risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76]
PARAGRAPH_84273: 6.2.1 General considerations

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:SETTLEMENT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84274: 169. Competent authorities should assess credit risk arising from all banking book exposures (including off-balance sheet items). They should also assess the counterparty credit risk and the settlement risk that could fall under both banking and trading books.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:76] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84275: 170. In assessing credit risk, competent authorities should consider all the components that determine potential credit losses, and in particular: the probability of a credit event (i.e. default), or correlated credit events, that mainly concerns the borrowers and their ability to repay relevant obligations; the size of exposures subject to credit risk; and the recovery rate of

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84277: the credit exposures in the event of borrowers defaulting. For all these components, competent authorities should take into account the possibility that these components may deteriorate over time and worsen compared to expected outcomes.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84278: 171. In addition, competent authorities should also pay attention to whether ML/TF risks are considered within the context of the credit-granting process, including whether the institution has systems and controls in place to ensure funds used to repay loans are from legitimate sources in accordance with the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring.30

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84279: 6.2.2 Assessment of inherent credit risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84280: 172. Through the assessment of inherent credit risk, competent authorities should determine the main drivers of the institution's credit risk exposure and evaluate the significance of the prudential impact of this risk for the institution. The assessment of inherent credit risk should therefore be structured around the following main steps:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84281: a. preliminary assessment;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84282: b. assessment of the nature and composition of the credit portfolio;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84283: c. assessment of portfolio credit quality;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84284: d. assessment of the level and quality of credit risk mitigation; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84285: e. assessment of the level of provisions and of credit valuation adjustments (CVAs).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84286: 173. Competent authorities should assess credit risk in both current and prospective terms. Competent authorities should combine the analysis of the current portfolio's credit risk with the assessment of the institution's credit risk strategy, credit risk appetite and credit risk limits (potentially as part of the wider assessment of strategy carried out as part of the BMA). Competent authorities should also consider how the expected, as well as the stressed, macroeconomic developments could affect those elements and ultimately the institution's earnings and own funds.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84287: 174. Competent authorities should primarily conduct the assessment at both portfolio and asset-class level. Where relevant, competent authorities should also conduct a more granular assessment, potentially at the level of single borrowers or transactions. Competent authorities may also use sampling techniques when assessing portfolio risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84288: 175. Competent authorities may perform the assessment vertically (i.e. by considering all the dimensions for relevant sub-portfolios) or horizontally (i.e. by considering one dimension, for example credit quality, for the overall portfolio).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:77]
PARAGRAPH_84289: 30 EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring (EBA/GL/2020/06)

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84291: Preliminary assessment

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84292: 176. To determine the scope of the assessment of credit risk, competent authorities should first identify the sources of credit risk to which the institution is or may be exposed. To do so, competent authorities should leverage the knowledge gained from the assessment of other SREP elements, from the comparison of the institution's position to peers and from any other supervisory activities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84293: 177. As a minimum, competent authorities should consider the following:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84294: a. the credit risk strategy and appetite and relevant limits;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84295: b. the own funds requirement for credit risk compared to the total own funds requirement, and - where relevant - the internal capital allocated for credit risk compared to the total internal capital, including the historical change in this figure and forecasts, if available;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84296: c. the nature, size, composition and quality of the institution's on- and off-balance sheet credit-related items;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84297: d. the level and change over time of impairments and write-offs and of the default rates of the credit portfolio; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84298: e. the risk-adjusted performance of the credit portfolio.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84299: 178. Competent authorities should perform the preliminary analysis considering the change in the above over time to form an informed view of the main drivers of the institution's credit risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84300: 179. Competent authorities should focus their assessments on those drivers and portfolios deemed the most material.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78]
PARAGRAPH_84301: Nature and composition of the credit portfolio

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84302: 180. Competent authorities should assess the nature of the credit exposures (i.e. the types of borrowers and exposures) to identify the underlying risk factors and they should analyse the composition of the institution's credit portfolio. Competent authorities should perform this analysis in both current and prospective terms, in light of the general macroeconomic situation.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:78] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84303: 181. In performing this assessment, competent authorities should also consider how the nature of credit risk exposure can affect the size of exposure (e.g. credit lines/undrawn commitments drawn down by borrowers, foreign currency denomination, etc.), taking into consideration the institution's legal capacity to unilaterally cancel undrawn amounts of committed credit facilities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84305: 182. To assess the nature of credit risk, competent authorities should consider at least the following subcategories of credit risk by carrying out a more detailed assessment of those subcategories which are considered most relevant for the institution:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84306: a. credit concentration risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:SETTLEMENT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84307: b. counterparty credit risk and settlement risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:SOVEREIGN_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84308: c. country risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84309: d. credit risk from securitisations;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84310: e. FX lending risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84311: f. specialised lending;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84312: g. equity risk in the banking book;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84313: h. real estate risk; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:MODEL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84314: i. model risk for regulatory approved models.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84315: Credit concentration risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84316: 183. Competent authorities should form a view on the degree of credit concentration risk, as referred to in Article 81 of Directive 2013/36/EU, to which the institution is exposed. Specifically, competent authorities should assess the risk that the institution will incur significant credit losses stemming from a concentration of exposures to a small group of borrowers, to a set of borrowers with similar default behaviour or to highly correlated financial assets.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84317: 184. Competent authorities should conduct this assessment by considering different categories of credit concentration risk, including:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84318: a. single-name concentrations (including a client or group of connected clients as defined for large exposures);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84319: b. sectoral concentrations;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84320: c. geographical concentrations;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84321: d. product concentration; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:79]
PARAGRAPH_84322: e. collateral and guarantees concentration.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84324: 185. To identify credit concentrations, competent authorities should consider the common drivers of credit risk across exposures and should focus on those exposures that tend to exhibit similar behaviour (i.e. high correlation).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84325: 186. Competent authorities should pay particular attention to hidden sources of credit concentration risk that can materialise under stressed conditions, when the level of credit risk correlation can increase compared to normal conditions and when additional credit exposures can arise from off-balance sheet items.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84326: 187. For groups, competent authorities should consider the credit concentration risk that can result from consolidation, which may be not evident at an individual level.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84327: 188. When assessing credit concentrations, competent authorities should consider the possibility of overlaps (e.g. a high concentration to a specific government will probably lead to a country concentration and single-name concentration), and should therefore avoid applying a simple aggregation of the different types of credit concentration, and should instead consider underlying drivers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84328: 189. To assess the level of concentration, competent authorities can use different measures and indicators, the most common being the Herfindahl-Hirschman Index (HHI) and Gini coefficients, which may then be included in more or less complex methodologies to estimate the additional credit risk impact.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84329: Counterparty credit and settlement risks

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84330: 190. Competent authorities should assess the counterparty credit risk arising from exposures to derivatives and securities financing transactions and settlement risks faced by institutions.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84331: 191. For this assessment, the following aspects should be considered, as relevant:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84332: a. the quality of counterparties and relevant CVAs, see also Section 6.3;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84333: b. the complexity of transactions;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84334: c. the wrong-way risk arising when the exposure to a counterparty is adversely correlated with the credit quality of that counterparty;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84335: d. the exposure to counterparty credit and settlement risks in terms of both current market values and nominal amount, compared to the overall credit exposure and to own funds;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84336: e. the proportion of transactions processed through financial market infrastructures (FMIs) that provide payment versus delivery settlement;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:80]
PARAGRAPH_84337: f. the proportion of transactions to central counterparties (CCPs) and the effectiveness of loss protection mechanisms for them, the proportion of

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84339: transactions to CCPs established in third countries, the effectiveness of loss protection mechanisms for them, and how any excessive exposure to non-EU CCPs is reduced, in particular in the context of Commission Implementing decision (EU) 2020/1308 of 21 September 202031 to give financial market participants until 30 June 2022 to reduce their exposure to UK CCPs;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84340: g. the proportion of non-centrally cleared OTC transactions and the effectiveness of loss protection mechanisms for them; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84341: h. the existence, significance, effectiveness and enforceability of netting agreements.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [RISK:SOVEREIGN_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84342: Country risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84343: 192. . Competent authorities should assess:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [RISK:SOVEREIGN_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84344: a. the degree of concentration within all types of exposures to country risk, including sovereign exposures, in proportion to the whole institution's credit portfolio (per obligor and amount);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84345: b. the economic strength and stability of the borrower's country and its track record in terms of punctual payment and occurrence of serious default events;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84346: c. the risk of other forms of sovereign intervention that can materially impair the creditworthiness of borrowers (e.g. deposit freezes, expropriation or punitive taxation);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84347: d. the risk arising from a potential event (e.g. a natural or social/political event) affecting the whole country to lead to default by a large group of debtors (collective debtor risk); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84348: e. the transfer risk linked to cross-border foreign currency lending for material cross- border lending and exposures in foreign currencies.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:SOVEREIGN_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84349: While country risk should be reflected under the credit risk, its assessment may also inform the analysis of other types of risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84350: Credit risk from securitisation

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84351: 93. Competent authorities should assess the credit risk related to securitisations where institutions act as originators, investors, sponsors or credit-enhancement providers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:81]
PARAGRAPH_84352: 31 Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2020/1308 determining, for a limited period of time, that the regulatory framework applicable to central counterparties in the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is equivalent, in accordance with Regulation (EU) No 648/2012 of the European Parliament and of the Council.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84354: 194. To appreciate the nature of relevant exposures and their potential development, competent authorities should:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84355: a. understand the strategy, risk appetite and business motivations of institutions in terms of securitisations; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84356: b. analyse securitisation exposures taking into consideration both the role played and the seniority of tranches held by institutions, as well as the type of securitisation (e.g. traditional vs. synthetic, securitisation vs. re-securitisation).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84357: 195. In assessing the credit risk arising from securitisation exposures, where they are considered material, competent authorities should assess, as a minimum:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84358: a. the appropriateness of allocation of securitisation exposures to the banking book and trading book and the consistency with the institution's securitisation strategy;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84359: b. whether the appropriate regulatory treatment is applied to securitisations;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84360: c. the rating and the performance of the securitisation tranches held by the institution, as well as the nature, composition and quality of the underlying assets;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84361: d. the consistency of the capital relief with the actual risk transfer for originated securitisations. Competent authorities should also verify whether the institution provides any form of implicit (non-contractual) support for the transactions and the potential impact on own funds for credit risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84362: e. whether there is a clear distinction between drawn and undrawn amounts for liquidity facilities provided to the securitisation vehicle; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84363: f. the existence of contingency plans for Asset-Backed Commercial Paper conduits managed by the institution in the event that an issuance of commercial paper is not possible because of liquidity conditions, and the impact on the total credit risk exposure of the institution.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82]
PARAGRAPH_84364: FX lending risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:82] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84365: 196. Competent authorities should assess the existence and materiality of the additional credit risk arising from FX lending exposures to unhedged retail and SME borrowers .In particular, competent authorities should assess any non-linear relationship between market risk and credit risk where exchange rates (market risk) may have a disproportional impact on the credit risk of an institution's FX loans portfolio. Where relevant, competent authorities should extend the scope of this assessment to other types of customers that are unhedged. In particular, competent authorities should assess the higher credit risk arising from:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84367: a. a material increase in both the outstanding value of debt and the flow of payments to service such debt; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84368: b. an increase in the outstanding value of debt compared to the value of collateral assets denominated in the domestic currency.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84369: 197. In evaluating FX lending risk, where it is considered material, competent authorities should assess:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84370: a. the type of exchange-rate regime and how this could affect the changes in the FX rate between domestic and foreign currencies;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84371: b. the institution's risk management of FX lending, measurement and control frameworks, policies and procedures, including the extent to which they cover non- linear relationships between market and credit risk. In particular, competent authorities should assesses whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84372: i. the institution explicitly identifies its FX lending risk appetite and operates within the specified thresholds;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84373: ii. the FX lending risk is taken into account when borrowers are assessed and FX loans are underwritten also considering the guidance for creditworthiness assessment of borrowers applying for foreign currency loans as specified in the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring32;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84374: iii. the FX lending risk, including risk concentration in one or more currencies, is appropriately addressed in the ICAAP;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84375: iv. the institution periodically reviews the hedging status of borrowers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84376: v. the impact of exchange rate movements is taken into account in default probabilities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84377: c. the sensitivity impact of exchange rate movements on borrowers' credit ratings/scoring and debt-servicing capacities; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84378: d. possible concentrations of lending activity in a single foreign currency or in a limited number of highly correlated foreign currencies.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84379: Specialised lending

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84380: 198. Competent authorities should assess specialised lending separately from other lending activities since the risk of such exposures lies in the profitability of the asset or project financed

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:83]
PARAGRAPH_84381: 32 EBA Guidelines on Loan origination and monitoring (EBA/GL/2020/06).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84383: (e.g. commercial real estate, energy plant, shipping, commodities, etc.) rather than the borrower (which is generally a special purpose vehicle).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84384: 199. Generally, these exposures tend to be of a significant size relative to the portfolio and so represent a source of credit concentration, of long maturity, which makes it difficult to make reliable projections of profitability.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84385: 200. In assessing the specialised lending exposures, where they are considered material,, competent authorities should consider:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84386: a. the profitability of the projects and the conservativeness of the assumptions underlying the business plans (including the credit risk of the main customers);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84387: b. the impact of changes in regulation, especially for subsidised sectors, on future cash flows;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84388: c. the impact of changing market demand, where relevant, and the existence of a market for the potential future sale of the object financed;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84389: d. the existence of a syndicate or of other lenders sharing the credit risk; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84390: e. any form of guarantee pledged by the sponsors.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84391: Equity risk in the banking book

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84392: 201. Competent authorities should assess the risk of decline in the value of the institution's equity investments and ensure that this risk is appropriately captured by the institution's risk framework. Such an assessment should particularly focus, where relevant, on participation risk in strategic holdings (both insurance and non-insurance).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84]
PARAGRAPH_84393: Real-estate risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84394: 202. Competent authorities should assess the risk of decline in the value of the institution's real estate investments and ensure that this risk is appropriately captured by the institution's risk framework. Such an assessment should also focus, where relevant, on the value of financial instruments linked to real estate assets (e.g. real estate investment trusts, REITs).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [RISK:MODEL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84395: Model risk for regulatory approved models

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:84] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [RISK:MODEL_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84396: 203. In cases where institutions are using regulatory approved internal models for the purpose of calculating own funds requirements for credit risk, competent authorities should monitor whether the institution continues to fulfil the minimum requirements and ensure that related own funds requirements are not underestimated. The assessment of model risk may be based on the insights gained in other supervisory actions, including those carried out in accordance with Article 101 of Directive 2013/36/EU.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84398: Assessment of the portfolio credit quality

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84399: 204. In assessing inherent credit risk, competent authorities should consider the quality of the credit portfolio, by carrying out an analysis to distinguish between performing, non-performing and forborne exposure categories, taking into account requirements of the EBA Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures33.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84400: 205. Competent authorities should assess the overall credit quality at portfolio level and the different quality grades within each of the above categories to determine the institution's overall credit risk. As part of this assessment competent authorities should analyse default and migration risk by exposure classes, taking into account trends in the credit quality over time, and they should consider whether the actual credit quality is consistent with the stated risk appetite, and establish reasons for any deviations.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84401: 206. When assessing portfolio credit quality, competent authorities should pay particular attention to the adequacy of the classification of credit exposures and assess the impact of potential misclassification, with the subsequent delay in the provisioning and recognition of losses by the institution. In conducting this assessment, competent authorities may use peer analysis and benchmark portfolios, where available. Competent authorities may also use sampling of loans when assessing portfolio credit quality.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84402: Performing exposures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84403: 207. In evaluating the credit quality of performing exposures, competent authorities should consider the change in the portfolio in terms of composition, size and creditworthiness, its profitability and the risk of future deterioration, by analysing the following elements, where available:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84404: a. borrowers' credit grade distribution (e.g. by internal and/or external ratings or other information suitable for measuring creditworthiness, such as leverage ratio, ratio of revenues devoted to the payment of instalments, etc.);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84405: b. growth rates by types of borrowers, sectors and products and consistency with credit risk strategies;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84406: c. sensitivity of borrowers' credit grades, or more generally of borrowers' repayment capacities, to the economic cycle;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84407: d. historical migration rates across credit grades, delinquency and default rates for different time horizons; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84408: e. profitability (e.g. credit spread vs. credit losses).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:85]
PARAGRAPH_84409: 33 EBA/GL/2018/06

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84411: 208. In performing these analyses, competent authorities should consider both the number of obligors and the relevant amounts/volumes and take into account the level of portfolio concentration.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84412: Forborne exposures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84413: 209. Competent authorities should assess the extent of forborne exposures, and the potential losses that may stem from them. As a minimum, this should include:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84414: a. the forbearance rates per portfolio and changes over time, also compared to peers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84415: b. the forbearance rates for different types of forbearance measures, including time horizons of the measures;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84416: c. the level and quality of collateralisation of forborne exposures; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84417: d. the migration rates of forborne exposures to performing and non-performing exposures, also compared with peers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84418: Non-performing exposures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84419: 210. Competent authorities should assess the materiality of non-performing exposures, including per portfolio and the potential losses that may stem from them. As a minimum, this should include:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84420: a. the non-performing rates and coverage per portfolio, sector, geography and changes over time, also taking into account the changes in the portfolios (e.g. growing portfolios vs expiring portfolios) and strategy with regard to non- performing exposures (e.g. recent sales of non-performing exposures);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84421: b. the distribution of the exposures across classes of non-performing exposures (i.e. past-due, doubtful, etc.);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84422: c. the types and values of collateral, where relevant;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84423: d. the migration rates from non-performing classes to performing, forborne exposures, and across non-performing classes;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84424: e. foreclosed assets and changes over time;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84425: f. historical recovery rates by portfolio, sector, geography or type of collateral and the duration of the recovery process; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:86]
PARAGRAPH_84426: g. the time since exposures were classified as non-performing, analysed by time buckets (vintage).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84428: 211. In conducting the above analysis, competent authorities should employ peer analysis and use benchmark portfolios (i.e. portfolios of borrowers common to groups of institutions) where appropriate and possible.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84429: Assessment of the level and quality of credit risk mitigation

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84430: 212. To assess the potential impact of credit risk on the institution, competent authorities should also consider the level and quality of guarantees (including credit derivatives) and of available collateral that would mitigate credit losses where credit events occur, including those not accepted as eligible credit risk mitigation techniques for own funds calculations.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84431: 213. 3. Specifically, competent authorities should consider:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84432: a. the coverage provided by collateral and guarantees by portfolio, borrower type, rating, sector and other relevant aspects;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84433: b. collateral values, for performing and non-performing exposures, including to what degree they meet the requirements of the EBA Guidelines on management of non- performing and forborne exposures (for collateral used to secure non-performing exposures) and EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring (for all collateral);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84434: c. historical recovery ratios by type and amount of collateral and guarantees; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84435: d. the materiality of the dilution risk (see Article 4 of Regulation (EU) 575/2013) for purchased receivables.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84436: 214. Competent authorities should also assess the materiality of the residual risk (see Article 80 of Directive 2013/36/EU) and in particular:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84437: a. the adequacy and enforceability of collateral agreements and of guarantees;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84438: b. the timing and the ability to realise collateral and execute guarantees under the national legal framework;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84439: c. the liquidity and volatility in asset values for collateral;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84440: d. the recoverable value of collateral under any credit enforcement actions (e.g. foreclosure procedures); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87]
PARAGRAPH_84441: e. where relevant, the guarantors' creditworthiness following the requirements of the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:87] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84442: 215. Competent authorities should also assess the concentration of guarantors and collateral, as well as the correlation with borrowers' creditworthiness (i.e. wrong-way risk) and the potential impact in terms of the effectiveness of protection.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84444: Assessment of the level of loan loss provisions and credit valuation adjustments

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84445: 216. Competent authorities should assess whether the level of loan loss provisions and credit valuation adjustments are appropriate for the quality of the exposures and, where relevant, for the level of collateral. Competent authorities should assess:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84446: a. whether the level of loan loss provisions is consistent with the level of risk in different portfolios, over time and compared with the institution's relevant peers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84447: b. whether the credit valuation adjustments to derivatives' market values reflect the creditworthiness of relevant counterparties;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84448: c. whether accounting loan loss provisions are in line with applicable accounting principles and are assessed as sufficient to cover expected losses;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84449: d. whether non-performing, forborne exposures and foreclosed assets have been subject to sufficient loan loss provisions, taking into account the level of existing collateral and the vintage of such exposures and applicable legal requirements for the minimum loss coverage of non-performing exposures; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84450: e. whether loan loss provisions are consistent with historical losses and relevant macroeconomic developments and reflect any changes to relevant regulations (e.g. foreclosure, repossession, creditor protection, etc.).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84451: 217. Where deemed necessary, competent authorities should use on-site inspections or other appropriate supervisory actions to assess whether or not the level of loan loss provisioning and risk coverage is adequate, by assessing a sample of loans, for example.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84452: 218. Competent authorities should also take into consideration any findings raised by internal and external auditors, where available.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88]
PARAGRAPH_84453: Stress testing

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84454: 219. When evaluating the inherent credit risk of an institution, competent authorities should take into account the results of stress tests performed by the institution to identify any previously unidentified sources of credit risk, such as those emerging from changes in credit quality, credit concentrations, collateral value and credit exposure during a stressed period.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84455: 6.2.3 Assessment of credit risk management and controls

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:88] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84456: 220. To achieve a comprehensive understanding of the institution's credit risk profile, competent authorities should also review the governance and risk management framework underlying its credit activities throughout the life cycle of a loan. To this end, competent authorities should assess the following elements, also having regard to the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring and the EBA Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84458: a. the credit risk strategy and appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84459: b. the organisational framework;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84460: c. policies and procedures;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84461: d. risk identification, measurement, management, monitoring and reporting; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84462: e. the internal control framework.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84463: 221. For the institutions subject to the application of the NPE (reduction) strategies and the associated governance and operational guidance in accordance with the EBA Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures, competent authorities should also assess whether institutions meet specific requirements set out in those guidelines for such strategies and their operationalisation, including with respect to meeting the consumer protection obligations.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84464: Credit risk strategy and appetite

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84465: 222. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has a sound, clearly formulated and documented credit risk appetite, strategy and limits approved by the management body. For this assessment, among other factors, competent authorities should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84466: a. whether the management body clearly expresses the credit risk strategy and appetite, as well as the process for their review;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84467: b. whether senior management properly implements and monitors the credit risk strategy approved by the management body, ensuring that the institution's activities are consistent with the established strategy, that written procedures are drawn up and implemented, and that responsibilities are clearly and properly assigned;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84468: c. whether the institution's credit and counterparty risk strategy reflects the institution's appetite levels for credit risk and whether it is consistent with the overall risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84469: d. whether the institution's credit risk strategy is appropriate for the institution given its:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84470:  business model;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84471:  overall risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:89]
PARAGRAPH_84472: . market environment and role in the financial system; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90]
PARAGRAPH_84474:  financial condition, funding capacity and adequacy of own funds;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84475: e. whether the institution's credit risk strategy covers its credit-granting activities and collateral management, as well as the management of non-performing exposures, and whether this strategy supports risk-based decision-making, reflecting aspects that may include, for example, exposure type (commercial, consumer, real estate, sovereign), economic sector, geographical location, currency and maturity, including concentration limits;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84476: f. whether the institution's credit risk strategy broadly covers all the activities of the institution where credit risk can be significant;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84477: g. whether the institution's credit risk strategy takes into account cyclical aspects of the economy, including under stress conditions, and the resulting shifts in the composition of the credit risk portfolio; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84478: h. whether the institution has an appropriate framework in place to ensure that the credit risk strategy is effectively communicated to all relevant staff.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90]
PARAGRAPH_84479: Organisational framework

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84480: 223. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate organisational framework and governance arrangements to enable effective credit risk taking, management, measurement and control, with sufficient (both qualitative and quantitative) human and technical resources to carry out the required tasks. Among other factors, they should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84481: a. there are clear lines of responsibility for taking on, measuring, monitoring, managing and reporting credit risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84482: b. the credit risk control and monitoring systems are subject to independent review and there is a clear separation between risk-takers and risk managers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84483: c. the risk management, measurement and control functions cover credit risk throughout the institution; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84484: d. the staff involved in credit-granting activities, credit risk management and management of NPEs, in particular NPE workout units (both in business areas and in management and control areas) have appropriate skills and experience to perform their tasks.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90]
PARAGRAPH_84485: Policies and procedures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:90] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84486: 224. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has appropriate policies for the credit granting, identification, management, measurement and control of credit risk, including collateral valuation, the recovery or sales processes, and whether such policies are in

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91]
PARAGRAPH_84488: line with the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring and the EBA Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures. For this assessment, among other factors, competent authorities should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84489: a. the management body approves the policies for managing, measuring and controlling credit risk and discusses and reviews them regularly, in line with risk strategies;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84490: b. senior management is responsible for drawing up and implementing the policies and procedures for managing, measuring and controlling credit risk, as defined by the management body;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84491: c. the policies and procedures are sound and consistent with the credit risk strategy, and cover all the main businesses and processes relevant to managing, measuring and controlling credit risk, in particular:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91]
PARAGRAPH_84492:  credit granting and pricing: for example, borrowers, guarantors and collateral eligibility; credit limits; selection of FMIs, CCPs and correspondent banks; types of credit facilities available; terms and conditions (including collateral and netting agreements requirement) to be applied;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84493:  credit risk measurement and monitoring: for example, criteria for identifying groups of connected counterparties; criteria for assessing borrowers' creditworthiness and collateral evaluation and frequency for their review; criteria for quantifying impairments, credit valuation adjustments and provisions; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91]
PARAGRAPH_84494:  credit management: for example, criteria for reviewing products, terms and conditions; criteria for applying forbearance practices or restructuring; criteria for loan classification and management of NPLs;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91]
PARAGRAPH_84495: d. the policies and procedures also specify how ML/TF risks to which the institution is exposed as a result of the credit granting activities are identified, assessed and managed both at the level of the business (in terms of types of customers served, lending products provided, geographies to which they are exposed and distribution channels used) and at the level of the individual relationship (considering the purpose of the credit, the extent to which the counterparty gives rise to ML/TF risk, and the legitimacy of the source of funds used to repay the credit);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84496: e. such policies are compliant with relevant regulations and adequate for the nature and complexity of the institution's activities, and enable a clear understanding of the credit risk inherent to the different products and activities under the scope of the institution;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:91]
PARAGRAPH_84497: f. such policies are clearly formalised, communicated and applied consistently across the institution; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84499: g. these policies are applied consistently across banking groups and allow proper management of shared borrowers and counterparties.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84500: Risk identification, measurement, monitoring and reporting

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84501: 225. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate framework for identifying, understanding, measuring, monitoring and reporting credit risk, in line with the institution's size and complexity, and that this framework is compliant with the requirements of the relevant EU and national implementing legislation.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84502: 226. In this regard, competent authorities should consider whether the institutions have adequate data infrastructure that meets the requirements of the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring, and of the EBA Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures and whether analytical techniques are appropriate to enable the institution to adequately manage their credit risk, and to fulfil supervisory reporting requirements, and to detect, measure and regularly monitor the credit risk inherent in all on- and off-balance-sheet activities (where relevant at group level), in particular with regard to:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84503: a. the borrower/counterparty/transaction's credit risk and eligibility;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84504: b. credit exposures (irrespective of their nature) of borrowers and, where relevant, of groups of connected borrowers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84505: c. guarantee and collateral coverage (including netting agreements) and eligibility of this coverage;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84506: d. ongoing compliance with the contractual terms and agreements (covenants);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84507: e. unauthorised overdrafts and conditions for reclassification of credit exposures; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84508: f. relevant sources of credit concentration risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84509: 227. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has a clear understanding of the credit risk related to the different types of borrowers, transactions and credit granted.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84510: 228. They should also assess whether the institution has appropriate skills, systems and methodologies to measure this risk at borrower/transaction and portfolio level, in accordance with the size, nature, composition and complexity of the institution's activities involving credit risk. In particular, competent authorities should ensure that such systems and methodologies:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92]
PARAGRAPH_84511: a. enable the institution to differentiate between different levels of borrower and transaction risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:92] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84512: b. provide a sound and prudent estimation of the level of credit risk and of collateral value with a distinct focus on exposures secured by residential and commercial immovable property collateral;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84514: c. identify and measure credit concentration risks (single-name, sectoral, geographical, etc.);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84515: d. enable the institution to project credit risk estimates for planning purposes and for stress testing;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84516: e. enable the institution to determine the level of provision and credit valuation adjustments required to cover expected and incurred losses; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93]
PARAGRAPH_84517: f. where material, aim to capture those risk elements not covered or not fully covered by the requirements of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:MODEL_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84518: 229. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution's management body and senior management understand the assumptions underlying the credit measurement system and whether they are aware of the degree of relevant model risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84519: 230. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has undertaken stress testing to understand the impact of adverse events on its credit risk exposures and on the adequacy of its credit risk provisioning. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93]
PARAGRAPH_84520: a. stress test frequency;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93]
PARAGRAPH_84521: b. relevant risk factors identified;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93]
PARAGRAPH_84522: c. assumptions underlying the stress scenario; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84523: d. the internal use of stress testing outcomes for capital planning and credit risk strategies.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84524: 231. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has defined and implemented continuous and effective monitoring of credit risk exposures (including credit concentration) throughout the institution, amongst others, by means of specific indicators and relevant triggers to provide effective early warning alerts.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84525: 232. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has implemented regular reporting of credit risk exposures, including the outcome of stress testing, to the management body, senior management and the relevant credit risk managers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93]
PARAGRAPH_84526: Internal control framework

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:93] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84527: 233. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has a strong and comprehensive control framework and sound safeguards to mitigate its credit risk in line with its credit risk strategy and appetite and whether such a control framework is line with the requirements of the EBA Guidelines on loan origination and monitoring and Guidelines on management of non-performing and forborne exposures. For this purpose, among other factors, competent authorities should pay particular attention to whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94]
PARAGRAPH_84529: a. the scope covered by the institution's control functions includes all consolidated entities, all geographical locations and all credit activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84530: b. there are internal controls, operating limits and other practices aimed at keeping credit risk exposures within levels acceptable to the institution, in accordance with the parameters set by the management body and senior management and the institution's risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84531: c. the institution has appropriate internal controls and practices to ensure that breaches of and exceptions to policies, procedures and limits are reported in a timely manner to the appropriate level of management for action; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84532: d. there are checks in place to identify, assess and manage ML/TF risks to which the institution is exposed as a result of the credit-granting activities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84533: 234. Competent authorities should assess the limit system, including whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84534: a. the limit system is adequate for the complexity of the institution's organisation and credit activities, as well as its capability for measuring and managing credit risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94]
PARAGRAPH_84535: b. the limits established are absolute or whether breaches of limits are possible. In the latter case, the institution's policies should clearly describe the period of time during which and the specific circumstances under which such breaches of limits are possible;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94]
PARAGRAPH_84536: c. the institution has procedures to keep credit managers up to date with regard to their limits; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94]
PARAGRAPH_84537: d. the institution has adequate procedures to update its limits regularly (e.g. for consistency with changes in strategies).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84538: 235. Competent authorities should also assess the functionality of the internal audit function. To this end, they should assess whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84539: a. the institution conducts internal audits of the credit risk management framework on a periodic basis;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84540: b. the internal audit function covers the main elements of credit risk management, measurement and controls across the institution; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94]
PARAGRAPH_84541: c. the internal audit function is effective in determining adherence to internal policies and relevant external regulations and addressing any deviations from either.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:94] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84542: 236. For institutions adopting an internal approach to determining minimum own funds requirements for credit risk, competent authorities should also assess whether the internal validation process is sound and effective in challenging model assumptions and identifying any

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:95] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84544: potential shortcomings with respect to credit risk modelling, credit risk quantification and the credit risk management system and to other relevant minimum requirements as specified in the relevant EU and national implementing legislation.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:95]
PARAGRAPH_84545: 6.2.4 Summary of findings and scoring

PARAGRAPH_84546: 237. Following the above assessment, competent authorities should form a view on the institution's credit and counterparty risk. This view should be reflected in a summary of findings, accompanied by a risk score based on the considerations specified in Table 4. If, based on the materiality of certain risk subcategories, the competent authority decides to assess and score them individually, the guidance provided in this table should be applied, as far as possible, by analogy.
