[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84580: 6.3 Assessment of market risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97]
PARAGRAPH_84581: 6.3.1 General considerations

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84582: 238. Competent authorities should assess the market risk concerning those on- and off-balance- sheet positions which are subject to losses arising from movements in market prices. When assessing market risk for institutions which do not meet the conditions of the small trading book as set out in Article 94 of Regulation (EU) 575/2013 competent authorities should consider the relevance and materiality of at least the following subcategories carrying out a more detailed assessment of those subcategories which are considered the most relevant for the institution :

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84583: a. interest rate risk in the trading book;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84584: b. credit spread and default risk in the trading book;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97]
PARAGRAPH_84585: c. equity risk in the trading book;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97]
PARAGRAPH_84586: d. foreign-exchange risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:97]
PARAGRAPH_84587: e. commodities risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84589: f. credit valuation adjustment risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84590: g. non-delta risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84591: h. basis risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84592: i. market liquidity risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MODEL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84593: j. model risk for regulatory approved models.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84594: 6.3.2 Assessment of inherent market risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84595: 239. Through the assessment of inherent market risk, competent authorities should determine the main drivers of the institution's market risk exposure and evaluate the risk of significant prudential impact on the institution. The assessment of inherent market risk should be structured around the following main steps:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84596: a. preliminary assessment;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84597: b. assessment of the nature and composition of the institution's positions subject to market risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84598: c. assessment of profitability;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84599: d. assessment of market concentration risk; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84600: e. outcome of stress testing.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84601: 240. Competent authorities may perform a less granular analysis for institutions which meet the conditions of the small trading book as set out in Article 94 of Regulation (EU) 575/2013.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84602: Preliminary assessment

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84603: 241. To determine the scope of the assessment of market risk, competent authorities should first identify the sources of market risk to which the institution is or may be exposed. To do so, competent authorities should leverage the knowledge gained from the assessment of other SREP elements, from the comparison of the institution's position to peers and from any other supervisory activities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84604: 242. As a minimum, competent authorities should consider:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98]
PARAGRAPH_84605: a. the institution's market activities, business lines and products;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:98] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84606: b. the main strategy of the market risk portfolio and the risk appetite in market activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84608: c. the relative weight of market risk positions in terms of total assets, changes over time and the institution's strategy for these positions;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99]
PARAGRAPH_84609: d. the relative weight of net gains on market positions in total operating income; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84610: e. the own funds requirement for market risk compared to the total own funds requirement, and - where relevant - the internal capital allocated for market risk compared to the total internal capital, including the historical change in this figure and forecasts.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84611: 243. In their initial assessments, competent authorities should also consider significant changes in the institution's market activities with the focus on potential changes in the total exposure to market risk. As a minimum, they should assess:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84612: a. significant changes in market risk strategy, policies and sizes of limits;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99]
PARAGRAPH_84613: b. the potential impact on the institution's risk profile of those changes; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99]
PARAGRAPH_84614: c. major trends in the financial markets and the institution's strategy towards it (including potential risks in case the trends unexpectedly reverse).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84615: Nature and composition of the institution's market risk activities

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84616: 244. Competent authorities should analyse the nature of the institution's market risk exposures by considering the subcategories defined in paragraph 238 to identify particular risk exposures and related market risk factors/drivers (e.g. exchange rates, interest rates or credit spreads) for further in-depth assessment.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84617: 245. Competent authorities should analyse market risk exposures by relevant asset classes and/or financial instruments according to their size, complexity and level of risk. For the most relevant exposures, competent authorities should assess their related risk factors and drivers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84618: 246. While analysing market risk activities, competent authorities should also consider the complexity of the financial products (e.g. over-the-counter (OTC) products or products valued using mark-to-model techniques) and of specific market operations (e.g. high-frequency trading). The following points should be considered:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84619: a. if the institution holds derivatives positions, competent authorities should assess both the market value and the notional amount; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:99] [RISK:CREDIT_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84620: b. when the institution is engaged in OTC derivatives, competent authorities should evaluate the weight of these transactions in the total derivatives portfolio and the breakdown of the OTC portfolio by type of contract (swap, forward, etc.), underlying financial instruments, etc. (the counterparty credit risk associated with these products is covered under the credit risk methodology).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84622: 247. When appropriate, competent authorities should assess the institution's evaluation of distressed and/or illiquid positions (e.g. 'legacy portfolios', i.e. portfolios of illiquid assets related to the discontinued banking practices/activities that are managed on a run-off model) and the impact of such positions on the institution's profitability.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100]
PARAGRAPH_84623: 248. For those institutions using the internal model approach (IMA) to calculate their regulatory own funds requirements, competent authorities should also consider the following indicators to identify particular risk areas and related risk drivers:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84624: a. the split of market risk own funds requirements between the value at risk (VaR), stressed VaR (SVaR), incremental risk charge (IRC) and charge for correlation trading portfolio;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100]
PARAGRAPH_84625: b. the VaR broken down by risk factors;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100]
PARAGRAPH_84626: c. the change in the VaR and SVaR (possible indicators could be the day-to-day/week- to-week change, the quarterly average and back-testing results); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100]
PARAGRAPH_84627: d. the multiplication factors applied to VaR and SVAR

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84628: e. the results of the calculations performed for the purpose of the specific reporting requirements for market risk, based on using the alternative standardised approach set out in Chapter 1a of Title IV of Part Three of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84629: f. where relevant, the results of the calculations performed for the purpose of the specific reporting requirements for market risk, based on using the alternative internal model approach (IMA) set out in Chapter 1b of Title IV of Part Three of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84630: 249. When appropriate, competent authorities should also consider the internal risk measures of institutions. These could include the internal VaR or expected shortfall not used in the calculations of own funds requirements or sensitivities of the market risk to different risk factors and potential losses.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84631: 250. When analysing inherent market risk, competent authorities should consider 'point-in- time' figures and trends, both on an aggregate basis and by portfolio. Where possible, this analysis should be completed with a comparison of the institution's figures to peers and to relevant macroeconomic indicators.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100]
PARAGRAPH_84632: Profitability analysis

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:100] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84633: 251. Competent authorities should analyse the historic profitability, including volatility of profits, of market activities to gain a better understanding of the institution's market risk profile. This analysis could be performed at portfolio level as well as being broken down by

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101]
PARAGRAPH_84635: business line, asset class or desk (potentially as part of the wider assessment carried out as part of the BMA).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84636: 252. While assessing profitability, competent authorities should pay specific attention to the main risk areas identified during the examination of market risk activities. Competent authorities should distinguish between trading revenues and non-trading revenues (such as commissions, clients' fees, etc.) on one hand and realised and unrealised profits/losses on the other hand.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84637: 253. For those asset classes and/or exposures generating abnormal profits or losses, competent authorities should assess profitability in comparison to the level of risk assumed by the institution (e.g. VaR/net gains on financial assets and liabilities held for trading) to identify and analyse possible inconsistencies. Where possible, competent authorities should compare the institution's figures to its historical performance and its peers.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84638: Market concentration risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84639: 254. Competent authorities should form a view on the degree of market concentration risk to which the institution is exposed, either from exposures to a single risk factor or from exposures to multiple risk factors that are correlated.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101]
PARAGRAPH_84640: 255. When evaluating possible concentrations, competent authorities should pay special attention to concentrations in complex products (e.g. structured products), illiquid products (e.g. collateralised debt obligations (CDOs)) or products valued using mark-to-model techniques.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101]
PARAGRAPH_84641: Stress testing

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84642: 256. When evaluating the inherent market risk of an institution, competent authorities should take into account the results of stress tests performed by the institution to identify any previously unidentified sources of market risk. This is especially important for tail-risk events, which may be underrepresented or entirely absent from historical data because of their low frequency of occurrence. Another source of potential hidden vulnerabilities that competent authorities should consider is the potential for jumps in pricing parameters, such as a sudden change in certain prices or price bubbles in commodities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84643: 6.3.3 Assessment of market risk management and controls

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84644: 257. To achieve a comprehensive understanding of the institution's market risk profile, competent authorities should review the governance and risk management framework underlying its market activities. To this end, competent authorities should assess the following elements:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:101] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84645: a. market risk strategy and risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84647: b. organisational framework;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84648: c. policies and procedures;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84649: d. risk identification, measurement, monitoring and reporting; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84650: e. internal control framework.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84651: Market risk strategy and appetite

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84652: 258. Competent authorities should assess whether institutions have a sound, clearly formulated and documented market risk strategy, approved by their management body. For this assessment, competent authorities should, in particular, take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84653: a. the management body clearly expresses the market risk strategy and appetite and the process for their review (e.g. in the event of an overall risk strategy review, or profitability and/or capital adequacy concerns);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84654: b. senior management properly implements the market risk strategy approved by the management body, ensuring that the institution's activities are consistent with the established strategy, written procedures are drawn up and implemented, and responsibilities are clearly and properly assigned;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84655: c. the institution's market risk strategy properly reflects the institution's appetite for market risk and is consistent with the overall risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84656: d. the institution's market risk strategy and appetite are appropriate for the institution, given its:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84657:  business model;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84658: . overall risk strategy and appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84659: . market environment and role in the financial system; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102]
PARAGRAPH_84660:  financial condition, funding capacity and capital adequacy;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84661: e. the institution's market risk strategy establishes guidance for the management of the different instruments and/or portfolios that are subject to market risk, and supports risk-based decision-making;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:102] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84662: f. the institution's market risk strategy broadly covers all the activities of the institution where market risk is significant;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84664: g. the institution's market risk strategy takes into account the cyclical aspects of the economy and the resulting shifts in the composition of the positions subject to market risk; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84665: h. the institution has an appropriate framework in place to ensure that market risk strategy is effectively communicated to all relevant staff.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103]
PARAGRAPH_84666: Organisational framework

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84667: 259. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate organisational framework for market risk management, measurement, monitoring and control functions, with sufficient (both qualitative and quantitative) human and technical resources. They should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84668: a. there are clear lines of responsibility for taking, monitoring, controlling and reporting market risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103]
PARAGRAPH_84669: b. there is a clear separation, in the business area, between the front office (position takers) and the back office (responsible for allocating, recording and settling transactions);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84670: c. the market risk control and monitoring system is clearly identified in the organisation, and functionally and hierarchically independent of the business area, and whether it is subject to independent review;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84671: d. the risk management, measurement, monitoring and control functions cover market risk in the entire institution (including subsidiaries and branches), and in particular all areas where market risk can be taken, mitigated or monitored; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103]
PARAGRAPH_84672: e. the staff involved in market activities (both in business areas and in management and control areas) have appropriate skills and experience.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103]
PARAGRAPH_84673: Policies and procedures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84674: 260. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has clearly defined policies and procedures for the identification, management, measurement and control of market risk. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84675: a. whether the management body approves the policies for managing, measuring and controlling market risk and discusses and reviews them regularly, in line with risk strategies;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:103]
PARAGRAPH_84676: b. whether senior management is responsible for developing them, ensuring adequate implementation of the management body's decisions;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84678: c. whether market policies are compliant with relevant regulations and adequate for the nature and complexity of the institution's activities, enabling a clear understanding of the market risk inherent to the different products and activities under the scope of the institution, and whether such policies are clearly formalised, communicated and applied consistently across the institution; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84679: d. for groups, whether these policies are applied consistently across the group and allow proper management of the risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84680: 261. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution's market policies and procedures are sound and consistent with the market risk strategy and cover all the main businesses and processes relevant for managing, measuring and controlling market risk. In particular, the assessment should cover:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84681: a. the nature of operations, financial instruments and markets in which the institution can operate;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84682: b. the positions to include in, and to exclude from, the trading book for regulatory purposes;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84683: c. policies regarding internal hedges;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84684: d. the definition, structure and responsibilities of the institution's trading desks, where appropriate;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84685: e. requirements relating to trading and settlement processes;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84686: f. procedures for limiting and controlling market risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84687: g. the framework for ensuring that all positions measured at fair value are subject to additional valuation adjustments in accordance with Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2016/101 (RTS on prudent valuation);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84688: h. the criteria applied by the institution to avoid association with individuals/groups involved in fraudulent activities and other crimes; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84689: i. procedures for new market activities and/or products; competent authorities should ensure that:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84690: . new market activities and/or products are subject to adequate procedures and controls before being introduced or undertaken;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84691: . the institution has undertaken an analysis of their possible impact on its overall risk profile.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:104]
PARAGRAPH_84692: Risk identification, measurement, monitoring and reporting

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84694: 262. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate framework for identifying, understanding and measuring market risk, in line with the institution's size and complexity, and that this framework is compliant with relevant minimum requirements in accordance with the relevant EU and national implementing legislation. They should consider whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84695: a. the data, information systems and measurement techniques enable management to measure the market risk inherent in all material on- and off-balance sheet activities (where relevant at group level), including both trading and banking portfolios, as well as complying with supervisory reporting requirements;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84696: b. institutions have adequate staff and methodologies to measure the market risk in their trading and banking portfolios, taking into account the institution's size and complexity and the risk profile of its activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84697: c. the institution's risk measurement system takes into account all material risk factors related to its market risk exposures (including basis risk, credit spreads in corporate bonds or credit derivatives, and vega and gamma risks in options). Where some instruments and/or factors are excluded from the risk measurement systems, competent authorities should assess the materiality of the exclusions and determine whether such exclusions are justified;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84698: d. the institution's risk measurement systems are able to identify possible market risk concentrations arising either from exposures to a single risk factor or from exposures to multiple risk factors that are correlated;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105]
PARAGRAPH_84699: e. risk managers and the institution's senior management understand the assumptions underlying the measurement systems, in particular for more sophisticated risk management techniques; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [RISK:MODEL_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84700: f. risk managers and the institution's senior management are aware of the degree of model risk that prevails in the institution's pricing models and risk measurement techniques and whether they periodically check the validity and quality of the different models used in market risk activities.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84701: 263. Competent authorities should assess whether an institution has implemented adequate stress tests that complement its risk measurement system. For this purposes, they should take into account the following elements:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105]
PARAGRAPH_84702: a. stress test frequency;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105]
PARAGRAPH_84703: b. whether relevant risk drivers are identified (e.g. illiquidity/gapping of prices, concentrated positions, one-way markets, etc.);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:105]
PARAGRAPH_84704: c. assumptions underlying the stress scenario; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84706: d. internal use of stress testing outcomes for capital planning and market risk strategies.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84707: 264. For the purposes of Article 101 of Directive 2013/36/EU, if the institution is authorised to use internal models to determine minimum own funds requirements for market risk, competent authorities should verify that the institution continues to fulfil the minimum requirements specified in the relevant EU and national implementing legislation and that such internal models do not involve any underestimation of material risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84708: 265. Competent authorities should assess whether institutions have in place an adequate monitoring and reporting framework for market risk that ensures there will be prompt action at the appropriate level of the institution's senior management or management body where necessary. The monitoring system should include specific indicators and relevant triggers to provide effective early warning alerts. Competent authorities should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84709: a. the institution has effective information systems for accurate and timely identification, aggregation, monitoring and reporting of market risk activities; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106]
PARAGRAPH_84710: b. the management and control area reports regularly to the management body and senior management with, as a minimum, information on current market exposures, P&L results and risk measures (e.g. VaR) compared to policy limits.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106]
PARAGRAPH_84711: Internal control framework

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84712: 266. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has a strong and comprehensive control framework and sound safeguards to mitigate its market risk in line with its market risk management strategy and risk appetite. They should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106]
PARAGRAPH_84713: a. the scope covered by the institution's control function includes all consolidated entities, all geographical locations and all financial activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84714: b. there are internal controls, operating limits and other practices aimed at ensuring market risk exposures do not exceed levels acceptable to the institution, in accordance with the parameters set by the management body and senior management and the institution's risk appetite; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84715: c. the institution has appropriate internal controls and practices to ensure that breaches of and exceptions to policies, procedures and limits are reported in a timely manner to the appropriate level of management for action. They should take into account whether the institution's internal controls and practices:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:106]
PARAGRAPH_84716:  are able to identify breaches of individual limits set at desk or business-unit level, as well as breaches of the overall limit for the market activities; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84718: . allow daily identification and monitoring of breaches of limits and/or exceptions.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84719: 267. . Competent authorities should assess the limit system, including whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84720: a. the limits established are absolute or whether breaches of limits are possible. In the latter case, the institution's policies should clearly describe the period of time during which and the specific circumstances under which such breaches of limits are possible;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84721: b. the limit system sets an overall limit for market activities and specific limits for the main risk subcategories; where appropriate, it should allow allocation of limits by portfolio, desk, business unit or type of instrument; the level of detail should reflect the characteristics of the institution's market activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84722: c. the set of limits (limits based on risk metric, notional limits, loss control limits, etc.) established by the institution suits the size and complexity of its market activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84723: d. the institution has procedures to keep traders up to date about their limits; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84724: e. the institution has adequate procedures to update its limits regularly.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84725: 268. Competent authorities should assess the functionality of the internal audit function. They should assess whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84726: a. the institution conducts internal audits of the market risk management framework on a regular basis;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107] [RISK:MARKET_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_84727: b. the internal audit function covers the main elements of market risk management, measurement and control across the institution; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]
PARAGRAPH_84728: c. the internal audit function is effective in determining adherence to internal policies and any relevant external regulations, and addressing any deviations from either.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107] [RISK:MARKET_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84729: 269. For institutions using internal models to determine own funds requirements for market risk, competent authorities should assess whether the internal validation process is sound and effective in challenging model assumptions and identifying any potential shortcomings with respect to market risk modelling, market risk quantification, the market risk management system and other relevant minimum requirements as specified in the relevant EU and national implementing legislation.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:107]

PARAGRAPH_84731: 270. Following the above assessment, competent authorities should form a view on the institution's market risk. This view should be reflected in a summary of findings, accompanied by a risk score based on the considerations specified in Table 5. Where, based on the materiality

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:108] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_84733: of certain risk subcategories, the competent authority decides to assess and score them individually, the guidance provided in this table should be applied, as far as possible, by analogy.

PARAGRAPH_84734: 271. Since factors such as complexity, level of concentration and the volatility of market exposures' returns may not be perfect indicators of the market risk level, in assessing and scoring inherent market risk, competent authorities should consider all these factors in parallel and not in isolation and understand the drivers behind volatility trends.
