PARAGRAPH_85431: 456. In conducting the assessment of risks to liquidity and funding as part of the SREP, competent authorities may use a combination of information sources, including:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85432: a. outcomes from the analysis of the institution's business model, particularly those that may help with understanding the key sources of risks to liquidity and funding;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85433: b. information from the monitoring of key indicators;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85434: c. supervisory reporting, and particularly the information provided by the institution in its liquidity and funding risk reporting pursuant to Article 415 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85435: d. outcomes of the various supervisory activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85436: e. information from AML/CFT competent authorities with a potential impact on liquidity and funding position;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85437: f. information provided by the institution, including information from the ILAAP;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:162]
PARAGRAPH_85438: g. findings and observations from internal or external audit reports;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85440: h. recommendations, guidelines and guidance included in LCR and NSFR implementation reports issued by the EBA, as well as warnings and recommendations issued by macroprudential authorities or the ESRB; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85441: i. risks identified in other institutions operating a similar business model (the peer group).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85442: 457. In their implementation of the methodologies and common elements specified in this title, competent authorities should identify relevant quantitative indicators and other metrics, which could be also used to monitor of key indicators as specified in Title 3.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85443: 458. The outcome of the assessment of each individual risk should be reflected in a summary of findings that provides an explanation of the main risk drivers and a score, as explained in the following sections.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85444: 8.2 Assessing liquidity risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85445: 459. Competent authorities should assess the institution's short- and medium-term liquidity risk over an appropriate set of time horizons, including intraday periods, to ensure that the institution maintains adequate levels of liquidity buffers, under both normal and stressed conditions. This assessment includes the following elements:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85446: a. evaluation of liquidity needs in the short and medium term;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85447: b. evaluation of intraday liquidity risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85448: c. evaluation of liquidity buffer and counterbalancing capacity; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85449: d. supervisory liquidity stress testing.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85450: 460. For the assessment of liquidity needs, buffers and counterbalancing capacity under normal conditions, competent authorities should support the analysis with evidence from the reporting templates for additional monitoring metrics as specified and introduced in the ITS on supervisory reporting45. Competent authorities may perform less granular intraday liquidity risk evaluation and liquidity stress testing, where this is justified by lower materiality of these sources of risk, especially for Category 3 and Category 4 institutions.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85451: Evaluation of liquidity needs in the short and medium term

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85452: 461. Competent authorities should assess the institution's liquidity needs in the short and medium term under both normal and stressed conditions (shocks). They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:163]
PARAGRAPH_85453: 45 5 Commission Implementing Regulation (EU) 2021/451.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85455: a. the institution's stressed liquidity needs at different times, in particular before 30 days, between 30 days and 3 months, and after 3 to 12 months, and specifically the effect on the institution's liquidity needs (net cash outflows) of severe but plausible stresses, to cover idiosyncratic, market-wide and combined shocks; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85456: b. the size, location and currency of the liquidity needs and, where an institution operates in different material currencies, the separate impacts of shocks in the different currencies, to reflect currency convertibility risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85457: 462. Competent authorities should support the assessment of short-term liquidity risk by analysing, as a minimum, the LCR as specified in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61, and in particular:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85458: a. whether the institution is correctly reporting its LCR position; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85459: b. whether the LCR adequately identifies the institution's liquidity needs.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85460: 463. In evaluating the impact of shocks on the institution's liquidity needs, competent authorities should take into account all material sources of liquidity risk for the institution. In particular, they should take into account, as relevant:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85461: a. the possibility that any applicable EU regulatory requirement would not adequately identify the institution's liquidity needs in the event of the type of stress scenario used for the requirement, including where maturities are shorter than 30 days.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85462: b. risks arising in respect of wholesale counterparties regarding on-balance-sheet items and funding concentrations, and taking into account actions the institution may take to preserve its reputation/franchise;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85463: c. risks arising in respect of contingent cash flows/off-balance-sheet items (for example, credit lines, margin calls) and activities (for example, liquidity support for unconsolidated special-purpose vehicles beyond contractual obligations), taking into account actions the institution may take to preserve its reputation/franchise;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85464: d. inflows and outflows on a gross basis as well as a net basis: where there are very high inflows and outflows, competent authorities should pay specific attention to the risk to the institution when inflows are not received when expected, even when the net outflow risk is limited;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:164]
PARAGRAPH_85465: e. risks arising in respect of retail counterparties, taking into account actions the institution may take to preserve its reputation/franchise. For this purpose, competent authorities should make use of the methodology on the classification of retail deposits into different risk buckets, pursuant to Articles 24 and 25 of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61 ;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85467: f. the risk that excessive risks in the medium- to long-term funding profile will adversely affect the behaviour of counterparties relevant to the short-term liquidity position; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85468: g. risk arising in the context of fiduciary deposits46.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85469: Evaluation of intraday liquidity risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85470: 464. Competent authorities should assess the institution's exposure to intraday liquidity risk for a selected time horizon, including the intraday availability of liquid assets given the unpredictable nature of unexpected intraday outflows or lack of inflows. Competent authorities may take into account potentially lower materiality of this source of risk, especially for Category 3 and Category 4 institutions. For all other institutions, where this source of risk is considered material, this assessment should include, as a minimum, an evaluation of intraday liquidity available or accessible under normal conditions as well as under financial or operational stress (e.g. IT failures, legal constraints on the transfer of funds, suspension/termination of access to correspondent banking services and/or clearing services for currencies, commodities or instruments significant for the institution).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85471: 465. For those jurisdictions where reporting on intraday risk is not yet available, competent authorities should rely on the institution's own analysis of intraday liquidity risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85472: Evaluation of liquidity buffer and counterbalancing capacity

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85473: 466. Competent authorities should assess the adequacy of the institution's liquidity buffer and counterbalancing capacity to meet its liquidity needs within a month as well as over different time horizons, potentially up to 1 year, including overnight. This assessment should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85474: a. the directly available liquidity buffers or the institution's survival periods under different stress scenarios;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85475: b. the overall counterbalancing capacity available to the institution over the full period of the relevant stress scenario;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85476: c. the characteristics, such as severity and duration, of different stress scenarios and periods considered in the evaluation of the institution's liquidity needs;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165]
PARAGRAPH_85477: d. the amount of assets that would need to be liquidated over the relevant time horizons;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:165] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85478: 46 The best practices are available in the EBA report: Monitoring of liquidity coverage ratio implementation in the EU - Second report (EBA/REP/2021/07).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85480: e. whether the actual liquidity buffer and counterbalancing capacity, including the quality of liquid assets, are in line with the institution's liquidity risk appetite; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85481: f. the classification and quality of liquid assets, as specified in Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61 (LCR Delegated Regulation)47.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85482: 467. Competent authorities should assess the institution's ability to monetise its liquid assets in a timely fashion to meet its liquidity needs during a stress period. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85483: a. whether the institution tests its market access by selling or repo-ing on a periodic basis;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85484: b. whether there are high concentrations that may represent a risk of overestimation of the liquidity buffer and counterbalancing capacity;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85485: c. whether the assets in the buffer are unencumbered (as defined in the EBA Guidelines on disclosure of encumbered and unencumbered assets48), under the control of the relevant staff and readily available to a liquidity management function;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85486: d. whether the denomination of the liquid assets is consistent with the distribution of liquidity needs by currency;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85487: e. where the institution has borrowed liquid assets, whether it has to return them during a short-term liquidity stress period, which would mean that the institution would no longer have them available to meet its stressed outflows considering the net effect of the transaction; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85488: f. the likely value of committed liquidity facilities, where competent authorities determine that such facilities can to some extent be included in the counterbalancing capacity.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85489: Supervisory liquidity stress testing

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85490: 468. Competent authorities should use liquidity stress tests, defined and run by the competent authorities, as an independent tool to assess short- and medium-term liquidity risks, to:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85491: a. identify liquidity risks over different time horizons and in various stress scenarios. Stress scenarios should be anchored to the 30-day LCR stress assumptions, but competent authorities may extend the scope of their assessment by exploring risks

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85492: 47 Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61 of 10 October 2014 to supplement Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 of the European Parliament and the Council with regard to liquidity coverage requirement for Credit Institutions (OJ L 11, 17.1.2015, p. 1-36).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:166]
PARAGRAPH_85493: 48 EBA Guidelines on disclosure of encumbered and unencumbered assets (EBA/GL/2014/03)

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85495: within 30 days as well as beyond 30 days, and altering the LCR assumptions to reflect risks not adequately covered in the LCR;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85496: b. inform their own view of liquidity risks in addition to the information from the institution's internal stress tests;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85497: c. identify and quantify specific areas of liquidity risk; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85498: d. inform their view on the overall liquidity risk to which the institution is exposed, which will enable them to compare the relative risk of institutions. As a minimum, this should include a supervisory stress test combining institution-specific and market-wide stress.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85499: 469. Competent authorities may assess the possible change in and sensitivity of the liquidity coverage requirement following the application of Articles 412(3) and 414 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 during mild stress scenarios, by means of supervisory or institution liquidity- specific stress testing. The scenarios applied for this assessment should typically be less severe (e.g. only market-wide stress) than the scenarios used to test the survival of the institution (market-wide and systemic stress) and consequently reflect situations in which institutions would not be expected to use their minimum liquidity buffer. When performing supervisory liquidity stress testing for Category 3 and Category 4 institutions, competent authorities may use fewer scenarios and apply lower granularity of the analysis than for other institutions.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85500: 8.3 Assessing inherent funding risk

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85501: 470. Competent authorities should assess the institution's funding risk and whether the medium- and long-term assets and off-balance-sheet items are adequately met with a range of stable funding instruments under both normal and stressed conditions. This assessment includes the following elements:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85502: a. evaluation of the institution's funding profile;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85503: b. evaluation of risks to the stability of the funding profile;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85504: c. evaluation of actual market access; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85505: d. evaluation of expected change in funding risks based on the institution's funding plan.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167]
PARAGRAPH_85506: Evaluation of the institution's funding profile

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:167] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85507: 471. Competent authorities should assess the appropriateness of the institution's funding profile, including both medium- and long-term contractual and behavioural mismatches, in relation to its business model, strategy and risk appetite. More specifically, they should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85509: a. whether the institution's medium- and long-term assets and off-balance-sheet items are adequately met with a range of stable funding instruments, pursuant to Article 413 of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, and whether its actual mismatches over the relevant time horizons are within acceptable boundaries in relation to the specific business model of the institution;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85510: b. whether - in light of the competent authority's view on the institution's desired funding profile - the institution's actual funding profile falls short of its desired profile;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85511: c. (local) regulatory and contractual factors affecting the behavioural characteristics of funding providers (e.g. regulations regarding clearing, bail-in, deposit guarantee schemes, etc., as they may influence the behaviour of funding providers), particularly when there are material changes or differences between jurisdictions in which the institution operates; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85512: d. that maturity transformation will lead to a certain level of mismatches but that these must remain within manageable and controllable boundaries to prevent collapse of the business model during stress periods or changes in market circumstances.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85513: e. where available, any supplementary information received from the AML/CFT supervisor on the exposure to ML/TF risks and the potential deficiencies of the ML/TF risk management system of the institution that could increase funding risk.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85514: 472. Competent authorities should support the assessment of the institution's funding profile by analysing, as a minimum, the NSFR as specified in Title IV of Part Six of Regulation (EU) No 575/2013, and in particular:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85515: a. whether the institution is correctly reporting its NSFR position; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85516: b. whether the NSFR adequately identifies the institution's stable funding needs.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85517: 473. Competent authorities should assess whether potential shortcomings arising from the institution's funding profile, such as maturity mismatches breaching acceptable boundaries, excessive concentrations of funding sources, excessive levels of asset encumbrance or inappropriate or unstable funding of long-term assets, could lead to an unacceptable increase in the cost of funding for the institution. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:168]
PARAGRAPH_85518: a. the risk of funding being rolled over at higher interest rates where there is an excessive dependence on specific sources of funding, the funding needs of the institution soar or the sources of funding perceive the institution as having a riskier profile, especially when it is not likely that those higher costs will be transferred automatically to clients; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85520: b. whether an increasing level of asset encumbrance above acceptable limits reduces access to and increases the price of unsecured funding.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85521: Evaluation of risks to the stability of the funding profile

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85522: 474. Competent authorities should consider factors that may reduce the stability of the funding profile in relation to the type and characteristics of assets, off-balance-sheet items and liabilities. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85523: a. the possibility that any applicable EU regulatory requirement would not adequately identify the stability of the institution's funding profile under normal or stress scenarios, including longer than 1-year time horizons;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85524: b. the fact that some specific asset classes will be more significant than others to the institution and/or the system;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85525: c. the structural maturity mismatch between assets and liabilities in different significant currencies, where applicable, as well as in aggregate, and how currency mismatches overlaying structural maturity mismatches affects the overall risk to the stability of the funding profile; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85526: d. appropriate structural funding metrics (appropriate to the institution's business model). Examples of structural funding metrics may include loan/deposit ratio, customer funding gap and behaviourally adjusted maturity ladder;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85527: e. funding characteristics that could indicate increased ML/TF risks and concerns from a prudential perspective (such as dependence on non-resident deposits especially from high-risk jurisdictions (as identified by the European Commission), deposits with foreign booking locations not consistent with the business model, or unusual interest rate settings compared to peers that are not consistent with the product type or institution's business model). Where such characteristics are identified, competent authorities should liaise with the AML/CFT supervisor to obtain their assessment on the ML/TF risk management system and determine the impact on the funding risk49.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85528: 475. Competent authorities should assess risks to the sustainability of the funding profile arising from concentrations in funding sources. They should take into account the following factors, as relevant:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85529: a. concentrations in different respects, notably and where applicable: the type of funding instruments used, specific funding markets, single or connected counterparties and other concentration risks that may affect access to funding in the future (focusing on the markets and instruments relevant to the long-term

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:169]
PARAGRAPH_85530: 49 In accordance with the EBA AML/CFT Cooperation Guidelines (EBA/GL/2021/15).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170] [RISK:CONCENTRATION_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85532: funding profile and noting that their view on concentration risk in the short-term liquidity profile may be relevant); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85533: b. the risk that asset encumbrance may have an adverse effect on the market's appetite for the unsecured debt of the institution (in the context of the specific characteristics of the market(s) in which the institution operates and the institution's business model). Factors for this assessment may include:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85534: . the total amount of encumbered and/or borrowed assets compared with the balance sheet;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85535: . the availability of free assets (assets that are unencumbered but that may be encumbered), especially when considered in relation to total unsecured wholesale funding;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85536: . the level of overcollateralisation relative to the capital base; overcollateralisation refers to the extent to which the value of the assets used to obtain secured funding exceeds the notional amount of funding obtained (e.g. if EUR 120 of assets are used for EUR 100 of secured funding, the overcollateralisation is 20); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85537: . the implications of the level of overcollateralisation for the deposit insurance scheme if the institution fails.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85538: Evaluation of actual market access

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85539: 476. Competent authorities should be aware of the institution's actual market access and current and future threats to this market access. They should take into account the following factors, as relevant

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85540: a. any information of which they are aware, including information from the institution itself, indicating that the institution makes high demands on particular markets or counterparties (including central banks) that are important to it, relative to those markets'/counterparties' capacity;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85541: b. any significant or unexpected changes in the issuance of debt of which competent authorities become aware in each significant market (including in significant currencies); note that competent authorities would expect institutions to alert them to any such changes. They should also assess whether any such changes are due to the strategic choices of the institution or whether they are signs of reduced market access;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:170]
PARAGRAPH_85542: c. the risk that news about the institution may negatively influence the market (perception/confidence) and therefore market access. Such news may or may not yet be known to the market; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85544: d. signs that short-term liquidity risks (e.g. when short-term liquidity risk is assessed as high) may reduce the access the institution has to its major funding markets.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85545: Evaluation of expected change in funding risks based on the institution's funding plan

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85546: 477. Competent authorities should assess the expected change in funding risks based on the institution's funding plan. This assessment should take into account the following aspects:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85547: a. the way the institution's funding plan, when executed in full, will affect the institution's funding risks, bearing in mind that the execution of the funding plan may increase or decrease the risks in the funding profile; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85548: b. the supervisory view of the feasibility of the plan.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85549: 8.4 Assessing liquidity and funding risk management

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85550: 478. To achieve a comprehensive understanding of the institution's liquidity and funding risk profile, competent authorities should also review the governance and risk management framework underlying its liquidity and funding risk. To this end, competent authorities should assess:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85551: a. the liquidity risk strategy and liquidity risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85552: b. the organisational framework, policies and procedures;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85553: c. risk identification, measurement, management, monitoring and reporting;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85554: d. the institution's liquidity-specific stress testing;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85555: e. the internal control framework for liquidity risk management;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85556: f. the institution's liquidity contingency plans; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171]
PARAGRAPH_85557: g. the institution's funding plans.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85558: Liquidity risk strategy and liquidity risk appetite

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85559: 479. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution appropriately defines and communicates its liquidity risk strategy and liquidity risk appetite. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85560: a. whether the liquidity risk strategy and liquidity risk appetite are established, approved and updated by the management body;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:171] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85561: b. whether the institution has an appropriate framework in place to ensure that the liquidity risk strategy is effectively communicated to relevant staff;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85563: c. whether the liquidity risk strategy and appetite are clearly defined, properly documented, effectively implemented and communicated to all relevant staff;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85564: d. whether the liquidity risk appetite is appropriate for the institution considering its business model, overall risk tolerance, role in the financial system, financial condition and funding capacity; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85565: e. whether the institution's liquidity risk strategy and appetite framework is properly integrated within its overall risk appetite framework.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172]
PARAGRAPH_85566: Organisational framework, policies and procedures

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85567: 480. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has appropriate arrangements for the governance and management of liquidity and funding risk. For this assessment, competent authorities should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85568: a. whether the management body approves the governance and policies for managing liquidity and funding risk and discusses and reviews them regularly;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85569: b. whether senior management is responsible for developing and implementing the policies and procedures for managing liquidity and funding risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172]
PARAGRAPH_85570: c. whether senior management ensures that the decisions of the management body are monitored;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85571: d. whether the liquidity and funding risk management framework is internally coherent and ensures ILAAP is comprehensive, and is well integrated into the institution's wider risk management process;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85572: e. whether the policies and procedures are appropriate for the institution, taking into account its liquidity risk appetite; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172]
PARAGRAPH_85573: f. whether the policies and procedures are properly defined, formalised and effectively communicated throughout the institution.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85574: 481. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate organisational framework for liquidity and funding risk management, measurement and control functions, with sufficient human and technical resources to develop and implement these functions and to carry out the required monitoring tasks. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85575: a. whether the liquidity risk control and monitoring systems and processes are controlled by independent control functions;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:172] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85576: b. whether the risk management, measurement and control functions cover liquidity risk in the entire institution (including branches), and in particular all areas where liquidity risk can be taken, mitigated or monitored;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85578: c. whether the institution has a set of liquidity and funding policy documents that are adequate for promoting prudent behaviour by the institution's staff (including with regard to deposit taking) and allowing for efficient operation of the control functions; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85579: d. whether the institution has appropriate internal written policies and procedures for the management of liquidity and funding risk, as well as the adequacy of the institution's liquidity and funding risk management framework.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85580: 482. Competent authorities should assess the adequacy of the institution's approach to maintaining market access in its significant funding markets. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85581: a. the institution's approach to maintaining an ongoing presence in the markets (testing market access); for specific small institutions or specialised business models, testing of access to markets may not be relevant;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85582: b. the institution's approach to developing strong relationships with funding providers to lower the risk of its access being reduced; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85583: c. any evidence that the institution would continue to have ongoing market access in times of stress (even though it may be more expensive for the institution to do so at such times).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85584: Risk identification, measurement, management, monitoring and reporting

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85585: 483. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an appropriate framework and IT systems for identifying and measuring liquidity and funding risk, in line with the institution's size, complexity, risk appetite and risk-taking capacity. They should take the following factors into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85586: a. whether the institution has implemented appropriate methods for projecting its cash flows over an appropriate set of time horizons, assuming business-as-usual and stress situations, and comprehensively across material risk drivers;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85587: b. whether the institution uses appropriate key assumptions and methodologies, which are regularly reviewed, recognising interaction between different risks (credit, market, etc.) arising from both on- and off-balance sheet items;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85588: c. when relevant, whether all material legal entities, branches and subsidiaries in the jurisdiction in which the institution is active are included; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:173]
PARAGRAPH_85589: d. whether the institution understands its ability to access financial instruments wherever they are held, having regard to any legal, regulatory and operating restrictions on their use, including, for example, the inaccessibility of assets due to encumbrance during different time horizons.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85591: 484. Competent authorities should assess whether institutions have an appropriate reporting framework for liquidity and funding risk. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85592: a. whether there is a set of reporting criteria agreed by senior management, specifying the scope, manner and frequency of liquidity and funding risk reporting and who is responsible for preparing the reports;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85593: b. the quality and appropriateness of information systems, management information and internal information flows supporting liquidity and funding risk management and whether the data and information used by the institution are understandable for the target audience, accurate and usable (e.g. timely, not overly complex, within the correct scope, etc.); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85594: c. whether specific reports and documentation containing comprehensive and easily accessible information on liquidity risk are submitted regularly to the appropriate recipients (such as the management body, senior management or an asset-liability committee).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85595: 485. Competent authorities should assess the adequacy of the process of measuring intraday liquidity risk, especially for those institutions that participate in payment, settlement and clearing systems. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174]
PARAGRAPH_85596: a. whether the institution adequately monitors and controls cash flows and liquid resources available to meet intraday requirements and forecasts when cash flows will occur during the day; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174]
PARAGRAPH_85597: b. whether the institution carries out adequate specific stress testing for intraday operations (where the institution should consider similar scenarios to those specified above).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85598: 486. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has an adequate set of indicators regarding the liquidity and funding position that are appropriate to the business model and the nature, scale and complexity of the institution. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85599: a. whether the indicators adequately reflect the institution's liquidity risk profile, such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174]
PARAGRAPH_85600: . the degree of diversification of liquid assets in the liquidity buffer between the various categories of liquid assets and within the same category of liquid assets and any other relevant diversification factors, such as types of issuers, counterparties or the geographical location of those issuers and counterparties;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:174]
PARAGRAPH_85601: . the degree of consistency between the currency denomination of their liquid assets and the distribution by currency of their net liquidity outflows;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85603: b. whether the indicators adequately cover key liquidity risk aspects related to potential cliff risks linked to, among others:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85604: . the concentration of outflows maturities, considering also any potential early withdrawal of liabilities, particularly in the short and medium term;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85605:  the central bank support programmes;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85606: c. whether the indicators adequately cover the institution's key structural funding vulnerabilities, covering the following aspects, where appropriate:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85607: . the degree of dependence on a single market or an excessively small number of markets/counterparties;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85608: . the 'stickiness' of funding sources and factors driving behaviour;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85609: . the concentration of activities in different currencies, namely the degree of consistency between the currency denomination of the available stable funding and the distribution by currency of the required stable funding;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85610: . the concentration of funding from specific lenders, including central banks, in the short, medium and long term;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85611: . major concentrations of maturities and maturity gaps over the longer term; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85612: d. whether the indicators are adequately documented, periodically revised, used as inputs to define the risk appetite of the institution, part of management reporting and used for setting operating limits.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175]
PARAGRAPH_85613: Institution's liquidity-specific stress testing

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85614: 487. Competent authorities should assess whether an institution has implemented adequate liquidity-specific stress testing as part of its overall stress testing programme, in accordance with the EBA Guidelines on institutions' stress testing, to understand the impact of adverse events on its risk exposure and on the quantitative and qualitative adequacy of its liquid assets, and to determine whether the institution's liquidity holdings are sufficient to cover risks that may crystallise during different types of stress scenarios and/or to address risks posed by control, governance or other deficiencies. For this purpose, competent authorities should take into account whether the institution's stress testing framework is appropriate for:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:175] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85615: a. determining the institution's survival horizon given its existing liquidity buffer and stable sources of funding, and taking into account the institution's risk appetite, during a severe but plausible liquidity stress period;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85617: b. analysing the impact of stress scenarios on its consolidated group-wide liquidity position and on the liquidity position of individual entities and business lines; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85618: c. understanding where risks could arise, regardless of its organisational structure and the degree of centralised liquidity risk management.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85619: 488. Competent authorities should also assess whether additional tests are needed for individual entities and/or liquidity subgroups that are exposed to significant liquidity risks. These tests should take into account the consequences of the scenarios over different time horizons, including on an intraday basis.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85620: 489. Competent authorities should ensure that the institution provides the modelled impact of different types of stress scenarios, as well as a number of sensitivity tests (on the basis of proportionality). Careful consideration should be given to the assessment of the design of stress scenarios and the variety of shocks simulated in them, taking into account whether, in this design, the institution not only considers the past, but also makes use of hypotheses based on expert judgement. Competent authorities should analyse whether the following scenarios are considered as a minimum:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85621: a. short-term and prolonged;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85622: b. institution-specific and market-wide (occurring simultaneously in a variety of markets); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85623: c. a combination of (i) and (ii).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85624: 490. An important aspect that competent authorities should consider when assessing the institution's stress testing framework is the modelling of the impact of the hypothetical stress scenario(s) on the institution's cash flows and on its counterbalancing capacity and survival horizon, and whether the modelling reflects the different impacts that economic stress may have on both an institution's assets and its in- and outflows.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85625: 491. Competent authorities should also assess whether the institution takes a conservative approach to setting stress testing assumptions. Depending on the type and severity of the scenario, competent authorities should consider, as relevant, the appropriateness of a number of assumptions, in particular:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85626: a. the run-off of retail funding;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85627: b. the reduction of secured and unsecured wholesale funding;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85628: c. the correlation between funding markets and diversification across different markets;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:176]
PARAGRAPH_85629: d. additional contingent off-balance sheet exposures;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85631: e. funding tenors (e.g. where the funding provider has call options);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85632: f. the impact of any deterioration of the institution's credit rating;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85633: g. FX convertibility and access to foreign exchange markets and correspondent banking accounts;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85634: h. the ability to transfer liquidity across entities, sectors and countries;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85635: i. estimates of future balance-sheet growth; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85636: j. due to reputational risks, an implicit requirement for the institution to roll over assets and to extend or maintain other forms of liquidity support.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85637: 492. Competent authorities should assess whether the management framework of the institution's liquidity-specific stress testing is appropriate and whether it is properly integrated into the overall risk management strategy. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85638: a. whether the extent and frequency of stress tests are appropriate to the nature and complexity of the institution, its liquidity risk exposures and its relative importance in the financial system;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85639: b. whether the outcomes of stress testing are integrated into the institution's strategic planning process for liquidity and funding and used to increase the effectiveness of liquidity management in the event of a crisis, including in the institution's liquidity contingency and recovery plan;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85640: c. whether the institution has an adequate process for identifying suitable risk factors for conducting stress tests, having regard to all material vulnerabilities that can undermine the liquidity position of the particular institution;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85641: d. whether assumptions and scenarios are reviewed and updated sufficiently frequently; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177]
PARAGRAPH_85642: e. where the liquidity management of a group is being assessed, whether the institution pays adequate attention to any potential obstacles to the transfer of liquidity within the group.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85643: Liquidity risk internal control framework

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85644: 493. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has a strong and comprehensive internal limit and control framework and sound safeguards to mitigate or limit its liquidity risk in line with its risk appetite. They should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:177] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85645: a. the limit and control framework is adequate for the institution's complexity, size and business model and reflects the different material drivers of liquidity risk, such

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85647: as maturity mismatches, currency mismatches, derivatives transactions, collateral management, off-balance-sheet items and intraday liquidity risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85648: b. the institution has limits in place to ensure consistency between the currency denomination of their liquid assets and the distribution by currency of their net liquidity outflows in accordance with Article 8(6) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85649: c. the institution has implemented adequate limits and monitoring systems that are consistent with its liquidity risk appetite and that make use of the outcomes of liquidity stress tests;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85650: d. the risk limits are regularly reviewed by the competent bodies of the institution and clearly communicated to all relevant business lines;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85651: e. there are clear and transparent procedures regarding how individual liquidity risk limits are approved and reviewed;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85652: f. there are clear and transparent procedures regarding how compliance with individual liquidity risk limits are monitored and how limit breaches are handled (including clear escalation and reporting procedures); and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85653: g. the limit and control framework helps the institution to ensure the availability of a diversified funding structure and sufficient and accessible liquid assets.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85654: 494. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has implemented an adequate transfer pricing system as part of the liquidity risk control framework. They should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85655: a. whether the institution's transfer pricing system covers all material business activities;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85656: b. whether the institution's funds transfer pricing system incorporates all relevant liquidity costs, benefits and risks;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85657: c. whether the resulting mechanism allows management to give appropriate incentives for managing liquidity risk;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85658: d. whether the transfer pricing methodology and its calibration are reviewed and updated appropriately given the size and complexity of the institution;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85659: e. whether the transfer pricing system and its methodology are communicated to the relevant staff; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:178]
PARAGRAPH_85660: f. as an additional factor, whether the institution's policy on incorporating the funds transfer pricing (FTP) methodology into the internal pricing framework is used for

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85662: assessing and deciding on transactions with customers (this includes both sides of the balance sheet, e.g. granting loans and taking deposits).

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85663: 495. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution has adequate controls regarding the liquid-assets buffer. They should take into account whether:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85664: a. the control framework covers the timely monitoring of the liquid-assets buffer, including the quality of the assets, immediate availability to the group entity using the assets to cover liquidity risks and any impediments to their timely conversion into cash;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85665: b. the institution has concentration limits in place between the various categories of liquid assets and within the same category of liquid assets in the liquidity buffer (by counterparty, type of issuer or the geographical location of those issuers and counterparties) in accordance with Article 8(1) of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85666: c. the institution has an appropriate policy on monitoring market conditions that can affect its ability to sell or repo assets quickly in the market.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85667: Liquidity contingency plans

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85668: 496. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution's liquidity contingency plan (LCP) adequately specifies the policies, procedures and action plans for responding to severe potential disruptions to the institution's ability to fund itself. They should take into account the content and scope of contingency funding measures included in the LCP, and in particular factors such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85669: a. whether the LCP adequately explains governance arrangements for its activation and maintenance.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85670: b. whether the LCP appropriately reflects the institution's liquidity-specific and wider risk profile.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179]
PARAGRAPH_85671: c. whether the institution has a framework of liquidity early warning indicators, including among others those established as liquidity indicators in the EBA GL on recovery plan indicators that are likely to be effective in enabling the institution to identify deteriorating market circumstances in a timely manner and to determine quickly what actions need to be taken.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:179] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85672: d. whether the LCP describes clearly that the LCR liquidity buffer is designed to be used in case of stress, even if that leads to LCR values below 100%, including that it is part of the expected management of liquidity risk under stress that subsequent communications to senior management take place if established lower LCR values are reached. The LCP should clearly reflect and describe how liquidity risk should

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85674: be managed under stress to steer towards targeted LCR levels as closely as possible.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85675: e. whether the LCP clearly articulates all material (potential) funding sources, including the estimated amounts available for the different sources of liquidity and the estimated time needed to obtain funds from them.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85676: f. whether the measures are in line with the institution's overall risk strategy and liquidity risk appetite.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85677: g. the appropriateness of the assumptions regarding the role of central bank funding in the institution's LCP. Examples of factors competent authorities may consider could include the institution's views on:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85678: . the current and future availability of potential alternative funding sources connected to central bank lending programmes;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85679: . the types of lending facilities, the acceptable collateral and the operational procedures for accessing central bank funds; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85680: . the circumstances under which central bank funding would be needed, the amount required and the period for which such a use of central bank funding would probably be required.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85681: 497. Competent authorities should assess whether the actions described in the LCP are feasible in relation to the stress scenarios in which they are meant to be taken. They should take into account factors such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85682: a. the level of consistency and interaction between the institution's liquidity-related stress tests, its LCP and its liquidity early warning indicators;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180]
PARAGRAPH_85683: b. whether the actions defined in the LCP appear likely to enable the institution to react adequately to a range of possible scenarios of severe liquidity stress, including institution-specific and market-wide stress, as well as the potential interaction between them; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85684: c. whether the actions defined in the LCP are prudently quantified in terms of liquidity-generating capacity under stressed conditions and the time required to execute them, taking into account operational requirements such as pledging collateral at a central bank.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:180] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85685: 498. Competent authorities should assess the appropriateness of the institution's governance framework with respect to its LCP. They should take into account factors such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85687: a. the appropriateness of escalation and prioritisation procedures detailing when and how each of the actions can and should be activated;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85688: b. whether the institution has adequate policies and procedures with respect to communication within the institution and with external parties; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85689: c. the degree of consistency between the LCP and the institution's business continuity plans.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85690: Funding plans

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85691: 499. Competent authorities should assess whether the funding plan is feasible and appropriate in relation to the nature, scale and complexity of the institution, its current and projected activities and its liquidity and funding profile. They should take into account factors such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85692: a. whether the funding plan is robust in terms of its ability to support the projected business activities under adverse scenarios;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85693: b. the expected change in the institution's funding profile arising from the execution of the funding plan and whether this is suitable given the institution's activities and business model;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85694: c. whether the funding plan supports any required or desired improvements in the institution's funding profile;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85695: d. their own view on the (changes in) market activity planned by institutions in their jurisdiction on an aggregated level, and what that means for the feasibility of individual funding plans;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85696: e. whether the funding plan is:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85697:  integrated with the overall strategic plan of the institution;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85698: . consistent with its business model; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181] [RISK:LIQUIDITY_RISK]
PARAGRAPH_85699: . consistent with its liquidity risk appetite;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85700: 500. In addition, competent authorities may consider:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:181]
PARAGRAPH_85701: a. whether the institution adequately analyses and is aware of the appropriateness and adequacy of the funding plan given the institution's current liquidity and funding positions and their projected development. As part of this, competent authorities may consider whether the institution's senior management can explain why the funding plan is feasible and where its weaknesses lie;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85703: b. the institution's policy for determining what funding dimensions and what markets are significant to the institution (and whether it is adequate);

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85704: c. the time horizon envisaged by the institution for migration to a different funding profile, if required or desired, bearing in mind that there may be risks involved if migration towards the end state is either too fast or too slow; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85705: d. whether the funding plan contains different strategies and clear management procedures for timely implementation of strategy changes.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182] [REQ_TYPE:MANDATORY]
PARAGRAPH_85706: 501. Competent authorities should assess whether the institution's funding plan is appropriately implemented. As a minimum, they should take into account:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85707: a. whether the funding plan is properly documented and communicated to all the relevant staff; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85708: b. whether the funding plan is embedded in the day-to-day operations of the institution, especially in the funding decision-making process.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85709: 502. In addition, competent authorities may take into account whether the institution is able to reconcile the funding plan with the data provided to competent authorities in the funding plan template.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85710: 503. Competent authorities should consider the quality of the institution's processes for monitoring the execution of the funding plan and its ability to react to deviations in a timely manner. For this assessment, competent authorities should take into account factors such as:

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85711: a. the quality of the updates to (senior) management regarding the current status of the execution of the funding plan;

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85712: b. whether the funding plan envisages alternative fall-back measures to be implemented if there are changes in the market conditions; and

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
PARAGRAPH_85713: c. the policy and practice of the institution regarding the regular review and updating of the funding plan when the actual funding raised significantly differs from the funding plan.

[JURISDICTION:FINNISH] [SOURCE:EBA] [CATEGORY:FINANCIAL_REGULATION] [PAGE:182]
